title: ideas for a keen4 mod...
content:
Hi there

Just some ideas here. I've been working on a keen4 mod and I thought I'd post my main ideas to see what you think...

---The story---

Mort developed a giant prison compound and long story short, captured a variety of people invaluble to keens' next stike againdt mort (14 in total - I modified the no. of people you had to rescue.)
(EDIT:these people are prisoners, captured by mort, held captive and tortured to find out how much they know before being excecuted.)

---Enemies---

The poison slug is replaced with a minelayer, a mechanical brute which creates and deploys landmines.

The Arachnut if the worst pain ever - a ton of frames to work from and quite big too. So far I thought a car-tank thing, that tries to run you over. Any help here would be appreciated, thanx.
(EDIT: now I have two arachnuts, one a toxin spewing robot used for testing, and modified to charge at keen as a weapon in later levels. the other is a mechanical security drone which I was given to by najawa. thanx, I'l be sure to include you in the credits!)

The bounder is an oddity. So far, I think I'll do some yorps that mortimer took with him from mars as test subjects.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img]

The blue-bird thing - aeroplanes that fly around. methinks something similar for the cloud - maybe a bombs drop for the cloud-lightning?

Mimrocks I'll probably drop altogether.

The lick has a *lot* of possibibities. A bouncing guard with a short range bio gun, a mechano-robot with a knife, drop attack police which raid the facility and misake keen for mort [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] the possibilites for this are quite good. If I can find a way, I'd try to do all this using the same sprite with modified grapics over.
(EDIT: the bouncing guard with a bio-gun (refered to ingame as bio-guards) is in! featuring dominantly throughout the facility, sometimes mutated due to bio exposure! some bieng other replacements, like mad mushroom and berkaloid. There are rumours that mort has been mutating them on purpose, but surely not even mort would go that far...)

Wormouths are also reasonably versatile. The oddest idea yet is something like those tinhat robots in keen1, but with a hidden stun gun.

The skypest is a delicate scout instrument, easily squashed [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

The berkeloid is some sorta soldier which throws grenades about.
(EDIT: Notso! What the heck was I thnking? The better idea sofar is the mutated bio-guard, which tries to shoot you but dislodges bio slop from his gun, (which is much worse than the normal guards, in some ways) which soars through the air. Rumour has it that as mort noiced that these were much better guards and more obedient, mort mutated them deliberately. But this cannot be more than just a rumour, can it...)

As mentioned before, the cloud is a plane which drops bombs around. I'm currently trying to extend the range of the plane's bombs' range. Any tips for this? it is proving much more difficult than I anticipated.

The mad mushroom is a mutated test-yorp (the bounder).
(EDIT: mutated bio guard.)

I'll probably drop the inchworms.

'underwater' creatures could be adjusted to fit the air, but they will probably also be dropped.

As an afterthought, can the 'dropped' sprites be adjusted to the extra 'licks'? This would be brilliant if possible.

[quote]Quote:[hr]Ummm... could you clarify that?[hr][/quote]

About the mid 1990's people became aware that although they could make Keen oh that much better if they altered say, the titlescreen position, they couldn't actually do that as editing the executable in ANY way was ilegal.

Then out of the gloom, one man had an idea, an idea that would shake the Keen community to its very foundations and make modding possible. By utilizing an obscure DOS command, he could patch the entire executable into memory, and run the game off of it. With this temporary program, any edits made to it wouldn't affect the EXE as such and were thus completely legal. The first patches arrived just weeks later.

And then a forum, patches began to collect, they began to form something other than a fun addittion people could fiddle with in their own home.

And then came KeenRush and the Yorphius mod.

Instantly a trend was set; people started downloading mods that had been specifically designed to be complete (legal) graphics remakes. The Keen community has never looked back since.

------

Anyways, there exists a program called Ck4patch (and 5patch, 6patch, dreamspatch and so on) that will allow you to legally 'edit' the executable. On the Keen:Modding forum there are instructions on where to download and how to use this nifty tool, but in your case the explainment is as follows:

The %patchfile command is used whenever the hack you've made is too large for you to bother with breaking it up into dozens of small one line patches such as:

%patch $4040 "This is my big story patch"
%patch $4059 "Zibble, another line! 1337"

Instead you'd use the %patchfile command, putting your entire code into one easy to make file:

%patchfiile $4040 Storytest.txt

In your case simply find the location you've editied to make your 1337 maps, copy the code to a file (any file, whatever) and use the %patchfile command.

title: Re: Barf on My Pupils!
content:
FWIW .BMP files can actually be compressed, but it only uses a very basic RLE compression (Run Length Encoding - which basically means instead of writing 100 black pixels, you write one black pixel and then a code that says "do this 100 times")

It's not used very often, and PNG's compression is vastly superior. You can also adjust the level of PNG compression with most programs, so you might want to try that too. PNG files can be uncompressed, so it's possible the program you're using just doesn't compress them at all and that's why they're similar in size to BMP.

And I guess the .BMP format isn't that popular because Microsoft invented it just for storing icons and graphics in Windows - and probably long after GIF came out. On the other hand, I'm sure .VOC came out before .WAV, but perhaps .WAV won out because although a slightly inferior format, it's much simpler to process from the programmer's point of view.

title: Re: Barf on My Pupils!
content:
"I read a programming book by Andre LaMothe, who said that it was easier to process .VOC files because they had a simpler format"

Well it depends how you look at it - the .WAV header is more complicated, but once you've read in the header you pretty much have an uninterrupted stream of sound data. The VOC format is divided into chunks, so while most sounds are one chunk of PCM data (and thus simpler than .WAV), you have to cater to the possibility that you'll come across a chunk of 'silence' data, a chunk of 'looped' sound data, etc. All in all there are about 10 or so different types of chunks you have to handle, and IMKO that's more complicated than just the one stream of PCM data you get with .WAV.
